thread.title: More than 700 years of South Devon fire service honoured

author: Tina Crowson
title: More than 700 years of South Devon fire service honoured
text:
More than 700 years of South Devon fire service honoured An original fire engine was back on station too Share The restored fire engine at the reunion (Image: Newton Abbot fire station) Share Comments 
More than 700 years of service to the community by firefighters who were ready to risk their lives has been marked in Newton Abbot . 
Current and past retained fire crews who worked at the Balls Corner station since it opened 45 years ago were reunited at a special event at the station. 
There were more than 50 at the special event, including included firemen who served at the station when it first opened as well as some new recruits to what is now Devon and Somerset Fire and Rescue Service. Altogether their service totalled some 708 years. The firefighters (Image: Newton Abbot fire station) 
Rob Cude from the station said the event developed from an idea of collecting information for a social media posting. Despite a lack of service records, they were able through word of mouth to contact many former firefighters. Read More 
One former station officer Derek Packer arrived in style aboard a former Devon Fire Service engine of the type which would have been used at the station, thanks to restorer Graham Isaacs of Paignton. The special cake (Image: Newton Abbot fire station) 
A special roll of honour featuring the names of all those who have served at the station has been created. Read More Ann Widdecombe on Brexit, Boris, Mogg, Trump, the NHS and why Anton should have replaced Bruce Forsyth on Strictly Come Dancing The roll of honour (Image: Newton Abbot Fire Station) 
Among the dignitaries at the event were Newton Abbot Mayor Ann Jones, Kingsteignton Mayor Ron Peart, assistant chief fire officer Glenn Askew and the chairman of the Fire Authority Sara Randall-Johnson. Like us on Facebook
